definition: to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A computer-generated random lottery drawing chooses selectees for diversity visas.
sentences.chinese: 該計劃由電腦隨機性抽籤選取申請人。

sentences.english: Still, we can reduce our reliance on stochastic outcomes.
sentences.chinese: 不過，我們可以減少對隨機性結果的依賴程度。

sentences.english: Thus, both slow convergence and randomicity in the time-interval between samples on the genetic algorithm are overcome.
sentences.chinese: 克服了遺傳算法收斂慢和每個採樣週期輸出的隨機性。

sentences.english: Therefore in this paper the randomness of the FAC has been studied.
sentences.chinese: 爲此，本文針對失效評定曲線的隨機性進行了研究。

sentences.english: The basic starting point of statistics is the stochasticity of the underlying system.
sentences.chinese: 統計的基本出發點是研究系統具有的隨機性。

sentences.english: Non-morphological criteria of metastasizing potential are largely speculative.
sentences.chinese: 非形態學的轉移潛力的指標大部分是隨機性的。

sentences.english: An obvious random feature can be found on both the original and the fully polished surfaces.
sentences.chinese: 原始表面和完全電拋光表面呈現較強的隨機性特徵。

sentences.english: This is due to randomness of searching for proof-of-work.
sentences.chinese: 這歸結於搜尋的隨機性爲證明工作。

sentences.english: Because computers are precise instruments, they are not designed to think randomly.
sentences.chinese: 因爲電腦是精密儀器，用電腦選號隨機性不強。

definition: bad money drives out good money (economics)
pinyin: lie4 bi4 qu1 zhu2 liang2 bi4

definition: to charge and break through enemy lines
Dacun township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
